page.title: 19TRANSPORT HOLBEACH DROVE
page.content: TRANSPORT IS VERY BUSY IN THE AREA ESPECIALLY ON THE MAIN THROUGH ROAD TO HOLBEACH WHICH RUNS THROUGH THE HOLBEACH DROVE VILLAGE. MANY LORRIES GO ALONG THIS ROAD AS IT IS THE MAIN ROUTE FOR THE NORFOLK LINE LORRIES WHICH HAVE THEIR DEPOT LOCALLY. THIS MAKES THE MAIN ROAD QUITE NOISY TO LIVE ON AND THE PETS HAVE TO TAKE EXTRA CARE! MOST RESIDENTS HAVE ONE OR TWO CARS AND ALTHOUGH THERE IS A BUS ROUTE, THEY PREFER TO DRIVE THEMSELVES TO EITHER WORK OR SHOPPING OR SOCIALLY OUT. ALSO CHILDREN HAVE TO BE TAKEN TO SCHOOL AND SCHOOL BUSES DO NOT RUN TO ALL SCHOOLS AVAILABLE TO THEM. THE AREA IS QUITE BUSY FOR AIRCRAFT AND IT IS NOT UNUSUAL TO SEE THE LANCASTER THE SPITFIRE AND THE HURRICANE FLY OVER TO AIRSHOWS AND THE BOMBERS WHICH PRACTICE ON THE LOCAL HOLBEACH MARSH RANGE.
